nodes.bodyText: ✏️ Nit: Looks like this isn't being used.
Opting to keep it in. I like having loggers in classes, even when they aren't being used.
✏️ Nit: Add @VisibleForTesting to setSignatureProperties and setEncryptionProperties.
✏️ Nit: Add unit tests for setSignaturePropertiesLocation and setEncryptionPropertiesLocation.

TLDR: lazy
Those setters call a static method and that static method is already being tested, so I don't see much value in adding complexity to the test cases (I would need to throw in properties file for that static method to read, and assert properties have been replaced). Let me know if I am mis-judging 😄
✏️ Nit: Can these be arguments instead of properties since they'll never change, right?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -46,8 +46,8 @@
         <property name="simpleSign" ref="simpleSign"/>
         <property name="issuer" value=""/>
         <property name="destination" value=""/>
-        <property name="signatureProperties" ref="signatureProperties"/>
-        <property name="encryptionProperties" ref="encryptionProperties"/>
+        <property name="signaturePropertiesLocation" value="${ddf.etc}/ws-security/server/signature.properties"/>
+        <property name="encryptionPropertiesLocation" value="${ddf.etc}/ws-security/server/encryption.properties"/>

nodes.bodyText: The entire class only uses properties, so I'm going to leave it as is for now.

nodes.bodyText: My suggestion was just a nit, but by arguments, I meant constructor arguments, as opposed to setting the fields via setters. Constructor arguments would allow the fields to be final, and the fields could still be used by the entire class.
